Authors: Kyoko Watanabe, Keiichi Motohasi, Yasunori Ono
Title:
Description of Pestalotiopsis pallidotheae: a new species
from Japan.
Abstract:
A new coelomycetes fungal species, Pestalotiopsis
pallidotheae, is described. This endophytic fungus,isolated from a leaf
of Japanese andromeda (Pieris japonica), has knob-tipped appendages on
the apical and basal cells of the conidia. The conidial morphology is
similar to that of Pestalotiopsis theae except that the color of the
median cells is paler in P. pallidotheae. Molecular analyses of the
ITS1-5.8S rRNA-ITS2 site placed P. pallidotheae in a group different
from P. theae.
